name: Sunset Vistas Beachfront Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week and really enjoyed doing very little. Rooms are large with 2 bedrooms each with a double bed, a separate lounge/diner with a full kitchen. Views are excellent, especially on the sunrise side where you can see for miles along the beach. All the staff we came into contact with were very friendly and extremely helpful. Trolly bus stop right outside the hotel, only a dollar for a ride all the way to Clearwater (for pensioners).
reviews.title: VERY RELAXING STAY

reviews.text: Recently returned from our annual golf trip. The rooms were perfect and spacious with a great view of the Gulf. Of "Special Mention" was the Manager Scott. He set us up on TWO Private Country Club's. In addition, he got us into the Private Yacht Club for a spectacular dinner. Will be going back for years - THANKS!
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned to South Dakota from Florida. Stayed a week here. Check in and check out was very good. The rooms were very nice. Had gulf view rooms, didn't face the gulf, but you could see it from the balcony. The beach was amazing and someone made an alligator in the sand. The tiki bar was open in the afternoon, but closed around sundown if there were any customers. The barmaids were nice and attentive, the drinks excellent. Good places to eat nearby and a grocery store was about a 1/2 mile. A good place to hang out and chill.
reviews.title: Relaxing vacation

reviews.text: Sunset Vistas was a great place to stay. The staff was very friendly and was able to accommodate our request to check in early. The room was clean and had plenty of space for our family. It is right on the beach and we had fantastic views from our balcony. The kitchen had anything you would need and the soap, shampoo and lotion were bath and body works products! The girl running the cafe was super friendly and the sandwiches she made us were delicious. It is close to everything! We had a great time sightseeing in the area and collecting shells on the beach.
reviews.title: 2013 Florida Trip

reviews.text: My daughter got married on the beach and our family stayed for 4 nights. We rented 8 two bedroom suites and everyone had a great time. The rooms were spacious and had everything you could ask for. They have two pools one for the small kids and one for the adults with 2 hot tubs. The beach was easy access and there was plenty of things to do close by.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: We stayed here for 10 days and we loved it. The pools were awesome and the people were very friendly. The internet was a bit slow but wasn't sure if it was them or my laptop. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again in the future.
reviews.title: Sunset Vistas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second trip to Treasure Island and the Sunset Vistas Beachfront suites... emphasis on beachfront! This lovely gem of a place is well maintained with excellent customer service and spectacular views of miles of sand and surf. We love the comfortable and friendly feel of the place, with a great grocery store near by and a wealth of excellent restaurants (Reviews to follow!) John's Pass is an easy walk away for a variety of shops and restaurants as well. Housekeeping comes by every other day to refresh towels, soaps , etc .. Great pool and hot tub facilities too!
reviews.title: A real treasure

reviews.text: The location on the fantastic beach of Treasure Island with walking distance to Johns Pass maks this a good choice for families looking for an active holiday. Designated parking spaces, heated pool and service minded staff.
reviews.title: Great location and good sized appartements

reviews.text: (Rooms could have been a bit cleaner on arrival, but not catastrophical in this either)
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: Sunset Vista is a great place to stay. It is a great value for your money. The people were very pleasant and helpful. Treasure Island is by John's Pass which is a very fun place to eat and shop. We loved that the ocean was right out front but that it also had a great pool and whirlpool on premises. Our room was large with a kitchenette which we stocked with breakfast and lunch meals.
reviews.title: Beautiful Spot with Fabulous Service!

reviews.text: Our family is 2 adults, 2 teenagers. We stayed in 611S for 1 wk.
reviews.title: Love the location

reviews.text: We specifically chose this unit because the 2nd bedroom has 2 twin beds.
reviews.title: Wouldn't change a thing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In reality, it is 2 squeaky COTS in a very tiny bedroom.
reviews.title: Location can't be better

reviews.text: Masterbedroom also needs a new bed.
reviews.title: Good for a hotel
Surprised by the Quality
reviews.text: The view, beach, pools, and location are fabulous!!

Our first trip to the Gulf Coast brought us to Treasure Island. We were meeting family members for a long weekend and needed easy access to the Tampa International Airport for our flight home. Trip Advisor always helps me find a hotel or vacation property and so we selected Sunset Vistas. We wanted two bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and a kitchen for minor food and beverage storage. Our suite/condo was clean, in good repair and just a short walk to the beach. The room had WiFi, HD cable tv and plenty of room to relax. Parking on the property was plentiful, the staff were friendly and tourism was the theme for the area. There were plenty of local and national restaurants to choose from. The property and the surrounding area was very quiet after 10pm and the neighborhood seemed to wake up after 900am each morning! Our trip to the airport only took 35-40 minutes in the Sunday morning light traffic and we will definitely consider this property for our next visit to the Gulf side of Florida!
reviews.title: A Good Choice Among Many!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice rooms. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom. Staff was very friendly and helpful. First floor is covered parking, recommend you ask to be on the third floor or higher to avoid the cold tile floor on the second level. Pool was nice with lots of seating and ocean beach was beautiful. Walking distance to Johns Pass for the shopper or if you would like a bit to eat
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Traveled here with my wife, infant son and my wifes parents. The place was easy to find and the condo/room was perfect for us. Very clean and comfortable. Nice size TV and great view from the balcony of the gulf. Stayed on the 6th floor right by the elevator and did not have any problems with noisy people. Rented a pack and play pen from hotel that worked out great. Was not in the room when we arrived but one phone call to the front desk and it was brought up immediately. Same with the towels. We called and fresh ones were brought up quickly. Hotel is right on a nice big beach so easy to access and were able to take some nice long walks. Also Johns Pass was very close and my wife and mother in law went there often and enjoyed themselves. From the hotel it was very easy to get to anywhere else in the area. Treasure Island itself is looking pretty run down and tired but seems to be getting a revival. Ate at the Middle Grounds Grill and it was excellent!! All in all a great vacation.
reviews.title: Excellent vacation away from the snow!!

reviews.text: We also stayed during the cool weather. The hotel is quiet, the staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great 2 weeks !

reviews.text: The suite layout is great, lots of space, and storage. A real plus with 2 bedrooms,
reviews.title: great beachfront location

aka: Sunset Vistas Beachfront Hotel Treasure Island
